There was a post on www.3-hajime.com/cgi-local/patio/patio.cgi
The title of the post is "Anecdote of Late Year?"

This is the babelfish translation...telling of an old Saito Hajime
appearing in an anime...(Usual warning about babelfish)

"It meaning that name of Saito one appears in the kendo cartoon,
"sword of 634", it does.
As a story of former times, the alone boy being Kawahara, when you
practice kendo, the old person coming, you say that try doing the
bamboo sword.
It was less crowded in the string and hung the can, practiced
piercing, but aiming for that can, the old person extended the bamboo
sword.
But, the can does not move jerkily.
When the boy tries seeing, you say that the hole opened in the can.
You say that with the bamboo sword, the can was carried out.
That was Saito one of late year.

With it meaning that the anecdote which is said is riding, it does,
but is this how probably what?
The う - the む, you question, it becomes.
Penetrating the being less crowded can which was hung to the string
with the bamboo sword how, being possible?
As an anecdote of Saito one, such a story it has been effective?"

There was a reply to the post along the lines that it is uncertain
whether or not this story was associated with historical S.H.  (The
important thing to me is that he is in yet -another- anime LOL).
